body:
It seems as though triggers with a condition and a may effect are not including the may option.

"At the beginning of each end step, <condition>, you may draw a card"

The may option is defaulting to 'yes' - It could be a preferences thing (double checking) But even if so, it's not displaying the result of the choice:

"Player may Player draw a card"

I've looked at the parsing for intervening_if but can't see anything obviously wrong

content:
_From [ShawnieBoyUK](https://code.google.com/u/ShawnieBoyUK/) on August 31, 2014 07:36:46_

It seems as though triggers with a condition and a may effect are not including the may option.

"At the beginning of each end step, <condition>, you may draw a card"

The may option is defaulting to 'yes' - It could be a preferences thing (double checking) But even if so, it's not displaying the result of the choice:

"Player may Player draw a card"

I've looked at the parsing for intervening_if but can't see anything obviously wrong

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/magarena/issues/detail?id=671_
